skillTree.localised_description: Taken by Fatandira from the tomb of the Liche Lord Karitamen in the Borderlands, this pair of Nehekharan Khopeshes magically enhance their owner's combat skills, and weakens anyone struck by them.

This ancient magical lamellar cuirass is said to have belonged to a legendary warrior queen of the Scythans who killed one of the great Priest Kings of Ancient Nehekhara in battle. The Scythans, believing Fatandira to be a reincarnation of that queen, have granted to her this ancient artifact.
Born to a family of Arabyan caravan nomads, Fatandira is as comfortable on the saddle as on foot.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can fire while on the move.

skillTree.localised_description: Given to Fatandira as a gift by the Scythans, Saqir is a mighty specimen of Desert Roc, giant and intelligent birds of prey that fly high above the deserts of Araby. The animal quickly bonded with her, and now they soar the battlefield together.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can fire while on the move.

skillTree.localised_description: Those proved in battle may take a sacred vow to their god Tutankhanut and serve as his mortal champion.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +2 with the Scythan god Tutankhanut and the faction of Numas.

Armour: +3 for all Tomb King units

	(Lord's army)

Fire resistance: +6% for all Tomb King units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Thorough drilling increases the peasants' chances of withstanding the horrors of battle.
This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.
Even from within their vessels the Djinn will protect their masters.
The relentless drive and fury of the elemental spirits, harnessed for the protection of this ward’s bearer.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Since her tenure as Princess in the Borderlands, Fatandira has sought to end the bigotry and hate that plague any land she rules. Her principality might be long gone, but the ideal stands strong.

Even back in the Border Princes, Fatandira was well known for her cavalry tactics and the swiftness of her mounted troops. Imagine what she can do with a saddle-born people such as the Scythans under her command.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +10% for all ranged Arabyan Nomad units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +12% for all Arabyan Nomad units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% for Camel Lancers, Desert Riders, Camel Archers and Camel Jezzails units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Since her arrival at Scythan lands, Fatandira has been hailed as "Al-Kahina", The Prophetess, by her people. The Scythans claim that she's the hero of legend that will banish the Darkness with the Golden God by her side. Fatandira herself doesn't quite believe the legend, but keeps up the appearance for the morale of her troops and well-being of her people.
"...From now on my destiny will be to lift these people out of ignorance and poverty, to prevent them from becoming as paranoid and vicious as the villagers who butchered my family. This I swear."

effects.description:
Construction cost: -15% for all buildings
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Fatandira is a woman with an iron determination. She leads honestly, and personally ensures that her troops have talent in battle and good sense out of it.
Fatandira has adapted her famously stealthy cavalry strikes from the rough terrain of the Border Princes to the sands of Araby and Nehekhara almost seamlessly.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.
If this unit can hide at its current location it will not be spotted until the enemy is very close.

skillTree.localised_description: Back in the Borderlands, Fatandira had quite the reputation as a markswoman among her troops. Since returning to her people, she has applied her skills to the Scythan way of the hunter.

ui_effects.localised_text: Scaled projectile damage against combatants with missing health
Requires line of sight to the target

skillTree.localised_description: Silent, swift and very, very deadly, this one can take down the foe from range without breaking a sweat or revealing his position.
Through the skin to kill the soul.
Only the foolish go on the hunt without supplies and a cast-iron plan.
Such advanced ballistic skills tend to rub off on one's subordinates.
"Be as cunning as the sand fox, strike as swift as the falcon!"

ui_effects.localised_text: Scaled projectile damage against combatants with missing health
Requires line of sight to the target

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

skillTree.localised_description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Warriors of great armies are decorated in ornate armour taken from the Sultan's personal armory, even the slaves!

skillTree.localised_description: The sand dunes are so large that a man can only cross them with his trusty mount.

skillTree.localised_description: Hit and run tactics work especially well in the desert. That's why the horsemen of Araby are particularly skilled marksmen.

skillTree.localised_description: Years of training and fighting in the scorching desert sun creates exceptionally tough fighters.

skillTree.localised_description: The powerful Djinns and various other monstrous creatures are fielded to destroy the enemies of Araby.

skillTree.localised_description: Veterans among the settled peoples, or "hadir", of Araby are able to be bestowed with titles and finery befitting their contribution to these great lands.

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: You have seen many brothers fall in battle, for that is what the nomads are, my brothers.

skillTree.localised_description: You are wise in the ways of magic and have much to teach others.

Melee attack: +5 for Dervishers, Enchanted Ropes, Genie, Desert Spirit, Fire Efreet, Sea Nymph, Tempest Djinn, Flying Carpets and Djinn Carriage units (Rank 7 and above)

skillTree.localised_description: They call him the beast whisperer, for these creatures would truly die for him.

Leadership: +5 for Waghzen, Elephants, War Elephant and Feral Giant Vulture units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: +15% for all beast units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
Every wound that is not fatal is but a lesson to learn from.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: Whether out of fear or conviction, this leader is able to rally a relentless force behind him.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can fire while on the move.

factionEffects.localised_description: The Scythans were once a nomadic people but now serve and defend the deserts of the Tomb Kings to the east.

effects.description: Fatandira's Allegiance: Side with either her Tomb King God Tutankhanut or with the people of Araby to earn rewards
If Numas is captured, honour your alliance and return Numas' capital to gain factionwide bonuses. However, betray Numas and you will receive temporary penalties
Diplomatic relations: +25 with the Scythan god Tutankhanut and the faction of Numas.
Enables recruitment of certain Tomb King units
Upkeep: -15% for all Arabyan Nomad units

items.colour_text: Taken by Fatandira from the tomb of the Liche Lord Karitamen in the Borderlands, this pair of Nehekharan Khopeshes magically enhance their owner's combat skills, and weakens anyone struck by them.

item_set.name: Wargear of Righteousness
item_set.description: With venerable armor and blades, Fatandira fights for justice and freedom.

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +8% after winning a battle

The Scythans, believing Fatandira to be a reincarnation of that queen, have granted to her this ancient artifact.

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +8% after winning a battle

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Fatandira had always known that she was descended from Arabyan nomads, but it was only recently, on her journey to the Southlands, that she discovered her Scythan legacy. Now she is the undisputed leader of her ancestral tribe.

effects.description:
Attribute: Stalk for Nomad Trackers, Jezzails, Southlands Warriors, Camel Lancers, Desert Riders, Camel Archers and Camel Jezzails units
	(Lord's army)
